careerObjective: To leverage my comprehensive skills in backend development, encompassing Node.js, React.js, and database management,along with my practical experience in collaborating on technical decisions and implementing robust CI/CD pipelines, to contribute effectively as a Backend Developer. Fueled by a passion for creating efficient, scalable, and well-performing applications, I aim to join a dynamic team where I can further enhance my expertise, innovate through cutting-edge technologies, and play an integral role in crafting seamless digital experiences.

description: Implemented a robust CI/CD pipeline responsible for automating build, testing, and deployment processes.
Developed highly scalable backend APIs and PostgreSQL database structures
Mentored interns as part of the team, fostering their professional growth while contributing to the project's success
Introduced tools such as uptime-kuma for monitoring the health of the application, flagsmith for feature flagging.
Led the development of dashboard integrating Thingsboard and custom Node APIs using flutter
Created a image annotation and tagging interface from the ground up, using React, Docker, and adept UI design. The resultant platform facilitated streamlined and accurate image annotation.
Created backend APIs and database structures for the image annotation platform using Node.js and PostgreSQL, ensuring seamless integration with the frontend.
Created visually appealing and responsive widgets in ThingsBoard
Created reusable React components and implemented state management using Redux, resulting in a highly modular and scalable codebase.
Created a documentaion for QA and testing of the application
Created static web pages using React.js and Bootstrap
Took charge of manual testing and meticulous review of code, ensuring seamless compatibility and averting potential website crashes upon deployment.

personalProjects.name: ResumeWiz
description: Created a JavaScript-based automated resume builder that generates and hosts resumes on GitHub Pages.
Implemented email notifications with the resume attached and a link to the hosted version upon code push to GitHub.
